main_definition: To substitute one thing or person with another in a particular context.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exchanging an item for a new or different one due to damage, wear, or obsolescence.
meanings_and_examples.example: When the old car broke down, I had to replace it with a newer model.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Substituting one person's role or responsibilities with another in a workplace setting.
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager decided to replace John as team leader because he was moving abroad.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Taking the place of an object or action that is no longer present, applicable, or valid.
meanings_and_examples.example: When they realized the outdated map wouldn't help them, they replaced it with a GPS system.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changing something old or ineffective for a new and improved version or method.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company decided to replace their old marketing strategy with a more modern approach.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To serve as an alternative or backup, often used when referring to tools or components within machinery.
meanings_and_examples.example: In case of failure, the spare part will be replacing the original one in the engine assembly.
